intro: Lamium grandiflorum, commonly known as greater deadnettle, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It features opposite, heart-shaped leaves that are covered in fine hairs, and it produces clusters of showy, two-lipped flowers in shades of pink to purple. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and thrives in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. It is often found in temperate regions and is known for its medicinal properties in traditional herbal remedies. The flowers bloom from late spring to early summer, attracting pollinators like bees and butterflies.
